intro: Cacalia rigida, commonly known as rigid cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a dense cluster. Cacalia rigida is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss.
